description:
Investigation of central developments in Western art music from ca.1200 to ca. 1600 including the evolution of polyphonic compositional techniques in sacred and secular genres, the expansion of music notation, the influence of humanistic thought on music, and the impact of the Reformation, printing and Western colonial expansion on musical creativity and dissemination.

Please note that this course offering may be cancelled if fewer than 10 students enrol.
prerequisites: MUSC1050 and MUSC2051, or Permission of Head of School of Music
restricted: course offering may be cancelled if fewer than 10 students enrol
